From a US Congressional Procedure perspective, this probability is not justified by the current procedural and logistical realities. The committee has explicitly abandoned plans to interview Maxwell, and there is no credible sign of a political or legal breakthrough imminent within the remaining few weeks. The forecast overweights the volatility of scandal-driven politics and underweights the inertia and risk aversion of congressional procedure once a witness signals only Fifth Amendment invocation and all bargaining leverage is exhausted. In practice, moral panics tend to produce document dumps, public hearings with more cooperative witnesses, or other symbolic gestures—not last-minute reversal on complex, high-risk, logistically fraught hearings with uncooperative federal inmates. Therefore, the probability should more closely reflect these hard constraints and recent institutional signals, and should be set much lower.

The resulting probability (7%) fits the facts and is somewhat bolder than the strict legal base rate, reflecting the real but remote possibility of elite interests aligning for a 'surprise' outcome. question_details.title: Will Ghislaine Maxwell give oral testimony on the Epstein Files or Epstein's relationship with Trump in a hearing at the US Congress before 2026?
question_details.description:
This question is synced with an identical question on Metaculus. The original question opened on 2025-07-24 13:00:00 and can be found [here](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/38916). This question will resolve to the same value as the synced question. The original question's background info at this time is below. 

According to the [NY Post](https://nypost.com/2025/07/22/us-news/house-oversight-committee-to-subpoena-ghislaine-maxwell-for-testimony/) on July 22, 2025: 

> The powerful GOP-led House Oversight Committee will “seek to subpoena” convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell for testimony about the Jeffrey Epstein case “as expeditiously as possible,” a spokesperson confirmed Tuesday.

> Rep. Tim Burchett (R-Tenn.) had requested Chairman James Comer (R-Ky.) summon the imprisoned British socialite for testimony. Comer instead asked Burchett to introduce a formal motion, which the panel approved by voice vote.

> “Since Ms. Maxwell is in federal prison, the Committee will work with the Department of Justice and Bureau of Prisons to identify a date when Committee can depose her,” a committee rep said.

Maxwell is [currently serving](https://www.politico.com/news/2025/07/22/ghislaine-maxwell-doj-questions-00468570) a 20-year prison term for child sex trafficking in connection with her long-time associate Jeffrey Epstein, who died in prison in 2019 by alleged suicide, under [suspicious circumstances](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Jeffrey_Epstein#Death). Epstein [has been speculated](https://www.newsnationnow.com/politics/jeffrey-epstein-conspiracies-intelligence-agent/) by influencers such as Tucker Carlson and Megyn Kelly to have been running a widespread blackmail operation as an asset for an intelligence service, such as Israel's Mossad. 

President Donald Trump [has described](https://www.npr.org/2025/07/19/nx-s1-5473430/trump-calls-release-jeffrey-epstein-grand-jury-testimony) the Epstein Files as a "SCAM" and a "hoax." According to the New York Times, Trump and Epstein [had](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/07/19/us/politics/inside-trump-epstein-friendship.html) a long friendship spanning 15 years.

Alan Dershowitz, Harvard Law professor emeritus and former attorney for Epstein [has said](https://thehill.com/regulation/court-battles/5411457-epstein-files-dershowitz-ghislaine-maxwell-testimony-trump-wall-street-journal-doj/) about Maxwell:

> She knows everything. She is the Rosetta Stone. She knows everything. She arranged every single trip with everybody. She knows everything.

`{"format":"metac_closes_in_period","info":{"post_id":38916,"question_id":38264}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that Ghislaine Maxwell has testified under oath at a hearing, in person or remotely, in either the US House of Representatives or US Senate regarding either what is popularly known as the Epstein Files (defined in the Fine Print) or Donald Trump’s association with Epstein.

The question resolves as **No** if this does not occur before that date. It may also resolve as **No** in the event of Maxwell being permanently unable to testify, such as her death.
question_details.fine_print:
* The Epstein Files [is defined as](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeffrey_Epstein_client_list) any of the evidence of criminal cases on the part of Jeffrey Epstein or any of his clients or associates, including but not limited to his contacts list or his flight logs.
* Any questioning regarding Donald Trump’s association with Epstein, including Maxwell denying or failing to recall any such association will count.
* In order to count, a hearing must include oral questioning by House members or Senators. Any hearing qualifies, including public, closed, or even secret hearings, as long as credible sources report before January 1, 2026 that Maxwell testified under oath regarding the Epstein Files or Trump's association with Epstein.
* Depositions do not count. Maxwell must appear at a hearing for this question to resolve as Yes.
* Maxwell invoking her Fifth Amendment right to avoid self-incrimination, even if invoked on every question, will not affect resolution.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Epstein Files Reveal Mossad Connection Allegations Amid Intelligence Influence Claims**
U.S. Republican Congressman Thomas Massie claimed that Israeli and U.S. intelligence agencies influenced the release of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, a convicted sex offender. Speaking in an interview, Massie stated that he believes Israel's intelligence agency, Mossad, was connected to Epstein, saying, 'I think he helped Mossad.' He further suggested that Epstein collected compromising information on politicians for blackmail purposes and provided women in exchange for favors, stating, 'He was someone who provided what his clients wanted, and in return, he obtained certain favors.' Massie emphasized that the full disclosure of Epstein's files would be embarrassing for both U.S. intelligence (CIA) and Israeli intelligence. The Epstein case, which involved allegations of sexual abuse of minors and running a sex trafficking ring, led to the deaths of prominent figures such as Prince Andrew, Donald Trump, Bill Clinton, Ehud Barak, Al Gore, Kevin Spacey, Michael Jackson, David Copperfield, Alan Dershowitz, and Bill Richardson, according to released documents. The FBI and U.S. Department of Justice concluded that no evidence was found for a 'client list,' and Epstein was ruled to have died by suicide in prison. Tucker Carlson previously claimed Epstein worked for Israel, asserting that 'everyone in Washington thinks this, but no one says it openly.' The Wall Street Journal reported that Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein's associate, asked a guest at Epstein’s 50th birthday party to write a letter to Trump, which was allegedly one of the letters sent.

Publish date: November 24, 2025 01:21 PM
Source:[NTV](https://www.ntv.com.tr/dunya/epstein-dosyalarinda-mossad-ayrintisi-1699171)

**U.S. Representative Claims CIA and Mossad Were Linked to Epstein**
U.S. Republican Representative Thomas Massie claimed in an interview that both the CIA and Israel's Mossad were influential in the process of releasing Jeffrey Epstein's files. Massie stated that he believes Israel's intelligence agency and the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) were connected to Epstein, and that Epstein likely assisted Mossad. He also suggested Epstein may have gathered compromising information on politicians for blackmail purposes, providing women in exchange for favors. Epstein, who was accused of sexual abuse and running a prostitution ring involving minors aged 14 and above, was found dead in his New York jail cell on August 10, 2019. The released court documents included prominent figures such as Prince Andrew, Donald Trump, Bill Clinton, Ehud Barak, Al Gore, Kevin Spacey, Michael Jackson, David Copperfield, Alan Dershowitz, and Bill Richardson. The FBI, after investigating with the U.S. Department of Justice, concluded there was no evidence of a 'client list' and that Epstein likely died by suicide, despite claims by some that he was murdered to suppress evidence. Tucker Carlson previously claimed Epstein worked for Israel, and the Wall Street Journal reported Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein’s associate, requested letters from prominent individuals for Epstein’s 50th birthday, including one from Trump.

**Justice Dept asks court to unseal Epstein grand jury files**
The U.S. Department of Justice has filed a motion requesting the court to unseal grand jury documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, citing a congressional mandate to release the materials within 30 days. The DOJ emphasized it would redact sensitive information, including details about sex-trafficking victims and other personal data. While the recently passed law does not explicitly reference grand jury testimony—only one witness’s testimony (an FBI agent) was confirmed in a New York case last summer—multiple grand juries, including in Florida, may have been involved, with the total volume of material unknown. Grand jury proceedings are confidential by law, protecting individuals not charged and allowing looser rules of evidence than in criminal trials. The Epstein case has remained politically charged, with Republican allies like former FBI Director Kash Patel advocating for release, while Democrats have questioned whether President Donald Trump knew of Epstein’s trafficking activities and failed to act. Trump, who had a past friendship with Epstein, denies any knowledge of underage prostitution and has called the allegations a 'hoax' used to deflect from Democratic failures. The Justice Department and FBI previously stated no further disclosure was warranted, but the Republican-led House Oversight Committee recently released thousands of pages from Epstein’s estate, including messages suggesting Trump knew of the abuse but did not participate. Epstein was indicted in 2019 and died in custody; Maxwell was convicted in 2022 and sentenced to 20 years. In 2025, she was transferred to a lower-security prison and interviewed by Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche, sparking Democratic accusations of leniency in exchange for potential testimony exonerating Trump—claims the White House strongly denies.
Original language: en
Publish date: November 23, 2025 06:53 PM
Source:[NZ Herald](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/justice-dept-again-asks-for-epstein-grand-jury-testimony-to-be-unsealed/KZV4FK4USJCFBBQULOYSUBRHVI/)

**Justice Department requests to unseal Epstein, Maxwell grand jury records**
The U.S. Department of Justice, led by Attorney General Pam Bondi, filed a motion on November 23, 2025, in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida requesting the unsealing of grand jury transcripts from the sex trafficking cases of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. This request follows the passage of the Epstein Files Transparency Act, which mandates the release of all unclassified Epstein-related records within 30 days. The Justice Department argued that the Act’s clear mandate requires the court to authorize disclosure and lift existing protective orders, while committing to redact victim-related and personal identifying information. The motion was signed by Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche and U.S. Attorney Jason Quinones and seeks an expedited ruling due to the 30-day deadline. President Trump, who previously opposed the bill, signed it into law on November 20, 2025, despite having once been friends with Epstein—though he has not been accused of wrongdoing. Epstein was indicted in July 2019 on federal child sex trafficking charges and died by suicide in August 2019. Maxwell was indicted in June 2020, convicted in December 2021, and sentenced to 20 years in prison. This is the latest effort to unseal the records; in August 2025, a New York judge denied a similar request, stating that the materials would not provide meaningful new information and could mislead the public. Epstein, a wealthy financier with high-profile connections, had pleaded guilty in 2008 to state charges in Florida and served 13 months in jail. The case gained renewed public attention in July 2025 when the Justice Department released a two-page memo claiming a 'systematic review' revealed an 'incriminating client list,' though no credible evidence of blackmail was found. This followed Bondi’s February 2025 statement that such a list was 'sitting on my desk right now.' Multiple batches of Epstein-related documents have been released over the years, with the most recent tranche of tens of thousands of pages released earlier in November 2025 by House Democrats and the House Oversight Committee.

Source:[CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/justice-department-requests-unseal-epstein-maxwell-grand-jury-records/)

**Congress warns Clintons over Epstein case**
US House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer has issued subpoenas requiring former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton to testify before Congress about their connections to Jeffrey Epstein, a convicted sex trafficker. The subpoenas, approved by the committee, mandate that both appear for in-person depositions—Bill Clinton on December 17 and Hillary Clinton the following day. Comer warned that failure to comply could result in contempt of Congress proceedings, citing their history with Epstein and his associate Ghislaine Maxwell. Epstein was first convicted in 2008 and charged again in 2019 with trafficking minors and operating an underage sex ring before dying in a Manhattan jail cell later that year. Bill Clinton previously admitted to traveling on Epstein’s jet but denied ever visiting Epstein’s island. A spokesperson for the Clintons stated that Bill Clinton severed ties with Epstein long before his 2019 arrest and was unaware of his alleged crimes. Meanwhile, on November 22, 2025, President Donald Trump signed a bill requiring the Justice Department to release Epstein-related files, marking a shift from his prior stance of opposing the release, which he had claimed was politically motivated by Democrats. Trump said the move could reveal 'the truth about these Democrats, and their associations with Jeffrey Epstein.'

**U.S. Department of Justice Repeats Call for Release of Epstein Case Grand Jury Documents**
The U.S. Department of Justice reiterated its request for the release of grand jury documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein case, following the passage and signing into law of the 'Epstein Files Transparency Act' by the U.S. Congress and President Donald Trump. In a filing with the Manhattan federal court, prosecutor Jay Clayton requested a swift ruling from Judge Richard Berman, arguing that the newly enacted law mandates the disclosure of grand jury records. The Department of Justice asserted that this law is the most recent and binding legal requirement for public access to such records. Judge Berman had previously rejected a similar request from the Trump administration, stating in August that the information in the records was already in the DOJ’s possession and that the content was 'insignificant.' Some victims of the Epstein case have expressed concern that releasing the documents could expose their identities, and thus oppose their public disclosure. Epstein, accused of sexual abuse involving over a dozen minors under 18 and operating a sex trafficking ring, was found dead in his New York City jail cell on August 10, 2019. The released case files included names of prominent figures such as Prince Andrew, Donald Trump, Bill Clinton, Ehud Barak, Al Gore, Kevin Spacey, Michael Jackson, David Copperfield, Alan Dershowitz, and Bill Richardson. The FBI, after investigating with the DOJ, concluded that no evidence was found of a 'client list' but determined that Epstein likely died by suicide, not murder, despite claims by some that he was killed to cover up a conspiracy involving government officials, celebrities, and businesspeople. Tucker Carlson claimed Epstein worked for Israel, while The Wall Street Journal reported that Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein’s associate, requested letters from notable individuals for Epstein’s 50th birthday, including one allegedly from Trump.

**Justice Department requests to unseal Epstein, Maxwell grand jury records**

**DOJ to start handing over Epstein files to Congress**
On August 22 2025, the Santa Clarita Valley Signal reported that the Department of Justice (DOJ) has agreed to hand over documents from the Jeffrey Epstein sex‑trafficking investigation to Congress. Rep. James Comer, R‑Ky., chair of the House Oversight Committee, said in a Monday‑night statement that 'There are many records in DOJ's custody, and it will take the department time to produce all the records and ensure that the identification of victims and any child sexual abuse material are redacted.' He added that he 'appreciates the Trump Administration's commitment to transparency and efforts to provide the American people with information about this matter.' The DOJ has not yet responded to a request for comment. Comer did not provide a timetable for the release of the documents. Earlier in the month, Comer had sent a subpoena to the DOJ for Epstein‑related records and deposition subpoenas to former officials from the Bush, Clinton, Obama and Trump administrations. The article notes that Epstein was found dead in his New York jail cell in 2019, ruled a suicide, and that his former girlfriend Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted in 2021 of aiding the sexual abuse of teenage girls and is serving a 20‑year prison sentence. Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche interviewed Maxwell at a Florida courthouse last month, and the DOJ has sought to unseal grand‑jury transcripts in the Epstein and Maxwell cases. Comer told reporters that former U.S. Attorney General Bill Barr had spoken with lawmakers on Monday, saying that Barr 'never had conversations with President [Donald] Trump pertaining to a client list, he didn't know anything about a client list' and that he had 'never seen anything that would implicate President Trump in any of this.' The DOJ and FBI officials earlier this month said there was no evidence that Epstein kept a 'client list' or engaged in a blackmail scheme, and that his death was due to suicide. Several members of Congress have attempted to pass resolutions to have the federal government release any files related to Epstein. The DOJ said it would move to unseal exhibits related to both the Epstein and Maxwell investigations, but a federal judge denied the DOJ's request for the grand jury materials, saying that the government failed to meet the exceptions applied in past rulings. Judge Paul Engelmayer wrote that 'Granting the government's motion would bloat the special circumstances doctrine, which to date has warranted disclosure in only a tiny number of cases, all involving unique testimony by firsthand witnesses to events of obvious public or historical moment.'

**US House of Representatives Subpoenas Bill and Hillary Clinton to Testify on Epstein Case**
The US House of Representatives' Oversight Committee has subpoenaed former President Bill Clinton and his wife, Hillary Clinton, who also served as US Secretary of State, to testify about the case of Jeffrey Epstein, a billionaire accused of trafficking minors who died in prison in 2019. In addition to them, former attorneys general and former FBI directors have been summoned to testify about the 'horrific crimes' committed by Epstein. Epstein had connections with Wall Street millionaires, members of the royal family (notably Prince Andrew), and celebrities before being convicted of child sex trafficking in 2008. The charges that led to his imprisonment in 2019 occurred more than a decade after a judicial agreement that protected him. He was found dead by hanging just over a month after being released from prison. As a campaign promise, President Donald Trump said he would release documents related to the Epstein case if he returned to the White House. In January, when the Republican released files on the investigation, a climate of dissatisfaction took over: the information already known. Pressured, Trump became the target of a conspiracy theory within his MAGA base, that he is on a secret list of people who benefited from Epstein's scheme. While Trump faces a showdown in MAGA, Republican Congressman Scott Perry managed to get approval for a subcommittee to demand testimony from the Clintons and former high-ranking federal agents. The expectation is that the testimonies will ultimately reveal more information about Epstein's conspiracy. At the same time, Democratic Congresswoman Summer Lee also obtained approval for a motion to summon DOJ files related to the case. It is, therefore, a bipartisan effort. After Perry and Lee's conquests, Republican President of the Investigative Committee, James Comer, sent the subpoenas to Bill and Hillary Clinton. Also summoned were former attorneys general Jeff Sessions, Alberto Gonzales and William Barr (who served in the governments of George W. Bush and Trump), and Merrick Garland, Loretta Lynch and Eric Holder (governments of Barack Obama and Joe Biden). Former FBI directors James Comey and Robert Mueller complete the list. In a letter to Bill Clinton, Comer recalled that the former president flew four times on Epstein's private jet. The congressman said that the Democrat would have 'pressured' the American magazine Vanity Fair not to publish accusations of sex trafficking against the billionaire. He also said that Clinton was 'supposedly close' to Ghislaine Maxwell, a British socialite who acted as Epstein's right-hand woman. Currently, she is serving a 20-year prison sentence, although she is trying to overturn the sentence. 'Given your previous relationships with Mr. Epstein and Mrs. Maxwell, the Committee believes that you have information about their activities that is relevant to the Committee's investigation,' Comer wrote. In addition, Comer wrote in a letter to Hillary Clinton that 'your family seems to have had a close relationship with both Jeffrey Epstein and his accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell.' The two, according to the congressman, may 'have knowledge of the government's efforts to combat international sex trafficking operations of the type commanded by Mr. Epstein.' The testimonies of Hillary and Bill were scheduled for 9 and 14 October, respectively.

**Ghislaine Maxwell Offers to Testify Before Congress in Exchange for Immunity and Clemency**
Ghislaine Maxwell, a British socialite convicted of sex trafficking and sentenced to 20 years in prison for her involvement in Jeffrey Epstein's scheme, has stated through her lawyers that she is willing to testify before the US Congress, but only if a list of demands is met. Maxwell has requested immunity from prosecution, advance access to questions, and even presidential clemency as conditions for testifying. In a letter sent to the chairman of the House Oversight Committee, Maxwell has asked that the hearing not take place at the federal prison in Tallahassee, Florida, where she is currently serving her sentence, and that it only occur after the resolution of a pending Supreme Court appeal and a future habeas corpus petition. She has also stated that she will not answer surprise questions. The letter also makes an explicit appeal to Donald Trump for clemency, stating that 'if she receives a pardon, she is willing -- and eager -- to testify publicly and transparently in Washington.' Maxwell's lawyer, David Markus, wrote that the request is strategic, as Trump has been criticized for not fulfilling his promise to reveal the truth about the Epstein case. According to Maxwell's defense, the committee's subpoena, scheduled for August, is 'unacceptable' in the current circumstances, as testifying from prison without minimum legal guarantees is 'an impossible starting point.' The initial plan was for Maxwell to invoke the Fifth Amendment, the right to remain silent to avoid self-incrimination. The House Oversight Committee has already publicly rejected the idea of granting immunity, stating that 'we do not consider granting parliamentary immunity to someone who may have participated in child sex trafficking.' However, the tone of the letter suggests a willingness to negotiate, stating that 'after careful consideration, we would like to find a way to cooperate with Congress, as long as there is a safe and fair path.'
